description: For m>0, each n+m > 5 is expressed as Sum_{k = x,y,z}(pk)_m where (pk)_m is a prime with x <= y <= z; a(n) = largest m such that (pk)_1 = (pk)_2 = ... = (pk)_m.
comments: Goldbach conjectured that every integer >5 is the sum of three primes. 6=2+2+2, 7=2+2+3, 8=2+3+3, 9=3+3+3=2+2+5,...
author: _Naohiro Nomoto_, Mar 05 2001
